data.title: Best Mexican in Waukegan!!
data.text: I had been to El Corporal in 2009 when I lived in Chicago and thought about their food for years and I finally came to waukegan again now. The food is better than I remembered! Everything is good but I tried the paradilla which is a combo of meats with cheese and peppers on the side served over fire. Hot tortillas and awesome salsa. Great food! It's unforgettable.

data.title: AMAZING!!!
data.text: The food here is so good! If you want authentic Mexican food this is the place to go. I have not found another restaurant in Waukegan that has good Mexican food and I have been to all of them in the Waukegan area. This one is definitely the best one!

data.title: Worth the trip from Downtown Waukegan (...it's about 4 blocks...)
data.text:
With so many restaurants moving out of downtown, I was looking for a lunch place and had been driving past El Caporal for years, so decided to go in. What a good idea!  Very clean, very nice service, and excellent food!  I got carry out and it was fast, not too expensive, and tastes great.
 My one complaint is that the music in the restaurant is way too loud.  However, if you like authentic Mexican foods with a wide variety of things to choose from, made simply and quickly, this is a good choice.  I will go back for sure!

data.title: Don't let the exterior scare you away
data.text: In town for a show at the Theater Downtown.  Our choice of food was overbooked, walked out of a Chinese restaurant for lack of service and were restricted on time.  GPS found this place a few blocks away.  Good choice.  Service and food were great.  Chips and Salsa.  Yum.  spicy, yet not overbearing.  Good portions, and reasonable prices.  My only comment would be the steak was a little salty for my taste, but had good flavor.  Not a fancy place by any means, just good food.  And a plus, the ladies bathroom was spotless!

data.title: Pure Mexican Goodness!
data.text: I love el caporal! It's the best mexican restaurant I have ever been to and no other one can compare to it. I love their gorditas de frijoles y queso and their agua de Jamaica! It is just pure Mexican Goodness!

data.title: A Little Mexican Corner Place for Family and Friends
data.text:
I like El Caporal and have recommended it to friends several times. For the longest time their Taco Dinner was the value in the city at $4.65 but has now bee raised to $5.75. Even at the higher price, I would compare it with any other in town. Fresh salsa (sometimes hotter than others) with just the perfect amount of cilantro and chips to start, small tortillas doubled up with carne, onions and cilantro, beans are good and rice(which I normally pass on) very good as well. 

One of the special dinners it Mocahete. This hot beef stew is fabulous. I ask to substitute rice for the beans side so that I can add it to the stew to decrease the temp. All in all a wonderful cultural experience. Brush up your Spanish skills!
